title: Latest ET Manufacturing | Latest Manufacturing News : ETManufacturing.in

items.title: Patel Engineering secures ₹240-cr order from NHPC
items.summary:
- *Patel Engineering* has won a ₹240 crore order from *NHPC* for the *Teesta-V project* in *Sikkim*.
- The project involves *civil and hydro mechanical works*, including modifications for a spillway arrangement.
- Completion is expected within 18 months, leveraging Patel's extensive experience in the region.

items.title: Reliance's Green Energy Expansion Sparks Analyst Optimism
items.summary:
- Reliance Industries is rapidly progressing on its $10 billion clean energy investment, aiming for *net-zero carbon emissions* by 2035.
- Analysts are optimistic about the potential of Reliance's new energy segment to become a key growth driver, with significant *solar solutions* and *battery manufacturing* efforts.
- Despite this optimism, near-term challenges include global solar overcapacity and potential U.S. trade impacts on Indian exports.

items.title: ZYOD Expands Production Capacity in Gurugram
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- ZYOD opened its largest facility in Gurugram, spanning over *1 lakh square feet* and housing over *750 machines*.
- The factory aims for an annual output of *60 lakh garments*, utilizing *IoT technology* and automated processes to enhance efficiency.
- This expansion will create *over 2,000 jobs* and strengthen partnerships with major retailers like **Marks & Spencer** and **Walmart**.

items.title: ADB grants ₹975 cr for Tripura's industrial infrastructure
items.summary:
- The *Asian Development Bank* has sanctioned a loan of ₹975.26 crore for infrastructure development in nine industrial areas of *Tripura*. 
- Projects include construction of *industrial sheds*, roadways, power substations, and fire service stations.
- Initiatives to boost the *plywood industry* and rehabilitation of mature rubber plantations are also underway, enhancing local economic opportunities.

items.title: India installs record 22 GW renewable capacity in H1 2025
items.author: Saurav Anand
items.summary:
* India achieved a record *22 GW* of renewable energy capacity in the first half of 2025, with *18.4 GW* from solar sources.
* The growth is attributed to developers taking advantage of a *waiver on interstate transmission charges* set to phase out by 2028.
* Despite the increase in renewables, *coal remains predominant* in India’s power generation, posing challenges to achieving net-zero goals.

items.title: Solar Energy Roofing on Public Sports Fields
items.summary:
- The Israeli government has allocated **34 million Shekels** ($10 million) for installing *solar energy roofing* on public sports fields.
- This initiative will enhance **energy security**, provide shade, and combat the *urban heat island effect*.
- The project supports Israel's goal of achieving **30% renewable energy by 2030** and aims to utilize existing infrastructure effectively.

items.title: Purabi Dairy set to double its processing capacity to 3 lakh litres per day
items.author: Bikash Singh, ET Bureau
items.summary:
- Purabi Dairy is expanding its processing capacity from 1.5 lakh to **3 lakh litres** per day to enhance milk production.
- The **Rs 104 crore** project aligns with Assam's dairy development strategy, aiming for improved rural livelihoods.
- The facility will also include new **ice cream production** capabilities and increase overall operational efficiency.

items.title: L&T to set up India's largest green hydrogen plant
items.summary:
- *Larsen & Toubro (L&T)* will establish the largest **green hydrogen plant** in India at IOCL's *Panipat Refinery*.
- The project will support the *National Green Hydrogen Mission*, aiming to make India a global leader in green hydrogen.
- The plant will provide **10,000 tonnes of green hydrogen annually** to IOCL for 25 years, contributing to decarbonisation efforts.

items.title: India's smartphone shipments jump 22% in Q2
items.author: Romit Guha, ET Bureau
items.summary:
**Key Highlights:**
- *Smartphone shipments in India increased by 22%* in Q2 FY25 compared to the previous quarter, bouncing back from two quarters of decline.
- Major contributions came from brands like *Vivo and Oppo*, which saw double-digit growth due to new affordable models and online sales.
- Despite challenges like climate disruptions and geopolitical tensions, *39 million shipments* were recorded due to preparedness for the upcoming festive season.

items.title: ADIA to invest $200 million in Gujarat-based medtech co Meril
items.summary:
- The *Abu Dhabi Investment Authority (ADIA)* will invest **$200 million** in Indian medtech company *Meril* for a nearly **3% stake**.
- This investment values Meril at *$6.6 billion*, enhancing ADIA's footprint in India’s **medical devices market**.
- Meril, founded by the *Bilakhia Group*, specializes in innovative healthcare solutions, exporting to over **150 countries**.

items.title: India Manufacturing First Commercial-Scale Semiconductor Chip
items.summary:
- India will produce its first *commercial-scale* semiconductor chip this year.
- IIT-Hyderabad students designed 20 chipsets, with eight progressing to the final design stage.
- The initiative aims to establish India as one of the top-5 *semiconductor* nations globally, boosting electronics manufacturing and exports.

items.title: Sona Comstar Joint Venture for EV Components in China
items.summary:
- *Sona Comstar* has partnered with *Jinnaite Machinery Co* to create a joint venture in *China* for manufacturing *driveline systems*.
- The venture involves an investment of $12 million from Sona Comstar, aiming to enhance its presence in the global *EV market*.
- Operations are set to begin in the second half of the financial year, aiming to leverage China's substantial *electric vehicle* opportunities.

items.title: China Electronics Entry May Hinge on Tech Transfer JVs
items.summary:
- The Indian government may support *Chinese investments* in electronics if they involve *joint ventures* and *technology transfer*.
- The Ministry of Electronics and IT emphasizes that such partnerships are crucial for India's manufacturing capabilities.
- Ongoing trade tensions and China's restrictions on exports could impact the *competitiveness* of India's electronics industry.

items.title: China Electronics Entry May Hinge on Tech Transfer JVs
items.author: Kiran Rathee, ET Bureau
items.summary:
- The Indian government may support *Chinese investments* in electronics through *joint ventures with Indian firms* that include *technology transfer*.
- Approval for such partnerships is crucial for boosting local manufacturing and achieving *higher local value addition* in electronics products.
- The rise in smartphone manufacturing in India highlights the need for Chinese expertise as domestic firms face challenges from *China's informal trade barriers* and restrictions on rare earth materials.

items.title: Govt, corporates settle tax row over factories in hilly regions
JSW Steel to invest ₹20,000 crore in Dolvi expansion
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- JSW Steel plans to invest *₹20,000 crore* primarily in expanding the Dolvi plant capacity from *10 million tonnes to 15 million tonnes* by September 2027.
- This capital expenditure is *19% higher* than the previous fiscal year’s spending, with most funding coming from *internal accruals*.
- The company aims for a target of *50 million tonnes annual production* by FY31, mainly through brownfield projects.

items.title: 1,190 MW Decentralised Solar Plants Installed in Rajasthan
items.summary:
- **1,190 MW** of *decentralised solar plants* were installed in Rajasthan under the **PM-KUSUM scheme** last year. 
- This initiative empowers farmers by enabling them to become *power producers* and offers low-cost electricity at **₹2.09-3 per unit**. 
- The state's goal is to provide daytime electricity for agriculture to all farmers by **2027**, aiming to significantly reduce *discom losses* exceeding ₹90,000 crore.

items.title: China's rare earth magnet exports to the US surge 660% in June
items.summary:
- China's rare earth magnet exports to the US skyrocketed by **660%** in June compared to May, with shipments reaching **353 metric tons**.
- This increase follows agreements to address previous trade barriers, particularly impacting industries reliant on these minerals like *electric vehicles* and *wind turbines*.
- Despite this surge, overall exports in the first half of 2025 declined **18.9%** from the previous year.

items.title: Rare earth magnet for ecocide in Myanmar
items.author: Dipanjan Roy Chaudhury, ET Bureau
items.summary:
- *Rare earth mining* in Myanmar's Kachin State is causing **severe environmental damage** and violating *human rights*.
- Local communities are heavily impacted, facing *polluted water* and loss of traditional livelihoods while receiving little compensation.
- Despite the substantial profits made by armed groups, the government benefits minimally, with most mining being *unregulated*.

items.title: Myanmar Flags Concerns Over Rare Earth Mining
items.summary:
- Myanmar's Kachin State faces severe *environmental damage* and *human rights violations* from rare earth exports to China.
- Increased mining activities linked to armed groups have led to *deforestation*, *water pollution*, and health risks for local communities.
- The local population endures *social instability* and environmental degradation while receiving little benefit from the mining revenues.

items.title: China starts construction on world's largest hydropower dam in Tibet
items.summary:
- China begins construction of the *world's largest hydropower dam* on the Tibetan plateau, costing approximately **$170 billion**.
- The project, with a capacity of *300 billion kilowatt-hours*, aims to support *renewable energy* goals and has raised concerns from India and Bangladesh about potential impacts downstream.
- Emphasizing ecological conservation is critical to avoid *environmental damage*, as NGOs warn of severe consequences for the local ecosystem and communities affected.

items.title: Mahindra, Sumitomo partner with Osaka to attract Japanese investment to Tamil Nadu
India's Green Hydrogen Investment Wave by 2030
items.author: Saurav Anand, ETEnergyWorld
items.summary:
- India aims for a *₹10 lakh crore* investment in green hydrogen by 2030 to boost its **National Green Hydrogen Mission**.  
- The country targets *5 million tonnes per annum* in production and *20 GW* in electrolyser capacity, significantly impacting sectors like fertilizers and steel.  
- Global competition is rising, as other nations set ambitious green hydrogen goals, positioning India as a **potential major exporter** due to its *competitive renewable energy tariffs*.

items.title: 2500th Electric Loco by BLW Inaugurated
items.summary:
- The *2500th electric locomotive* by Banaras Locomotive Works (BLW) was inaugurated on July 20, 2025.  
- This *WAP-7 class locomotive* features advanced technologies and an eco-friendly design, set to operate at *Krishnarajapuram Loco Shed*.  
- BLW has shown significant growth, reaching this milestone in just eight years since starting electric locomotive production.

items.title: Torrent Power plans Rs 50,000 crore investment in renewable energy capacity expansion
items.summary:
- Torrent Power aims to invest *Rs 50,000 crore* over 3-4 years to enhance its *renewable energy capacity*. 
- The investment focuses on three sectors: *Rs 20,000 crore* in renewable energy, *Rs 14,000 crore* in pumped storage, and *Rs 16,000 crore* in T&D. 
- By 2030, the company targets *10 GW* of renewable capacity, significantly increasing from its current *1.75 GW*.

items.title: NTPC REL inks pact with Goa govt to develop 300 MW renewable projects
India-EFTA free trade pact to come into effect from October 1: Piyush Goyal
ICMR Invites EoI for Advanced Malaria Vaccine Production
items.summary:
- The ICMR has developed the *AdFalciVax*, a multi-stage malaria vaccine targeting *plasmodium falciparum*.
- An expression of interest (EoI) is open for organizations interested in the *commercial production* and *technology transfer* of this vaccine.
- ICMR will provide *technical support* throughout the vaccine's production phases, ensuring effective development and commercialization.

items.title: Kazipet Railway Manufacturing Unit to Begin by 2026
items.author: ANI
items.summary:
- The *Kazipet Railway Manufacturing Unit* in Telangana will start operations by **2026**.  
- The facility, with a **₹500 crore** investment, aims to manufacture railway coaches and engines, enhancing local *employment* opportunities.  
- Union Minister *Ashwini Vaishnaw* stated that this modern factory will utilize the latest technology, including **robotic painting**, to boost efficiency.

items.title: The Future of Indian Exports via Indigenous Manufacturing
items.summary:
- *Indigenous manufacturing* at port cities can enhance the speed and efficiency of exports in India.
- This strategy aims to reduce logistics costs by co-locating production with ports, potentially increasing India's export performance significantly.
- To maximize benefits, India needs to focus on *policy integration*, *infrastructure development*, and *export-linked incentives* to support coastal manufacturing initiatives.

items.title: RRP Defence Partners with CYGR for Drone Plant
items.summary:
- RRP Defence has partnered with French firm *CYGR* to establish a *drone manufacturing facility* in *Navi Mumbai*.
- The initial investment of around **USD 50 million** aims to produce advanced drone systems for *defense* and *industrial use*.
- This collaboration will enhance India's *high-skill employment* and boost *aerospace exports*.

items.title: India aims to be among top 5 chipmaking nations: Ashwini Vaishnaw
items.summary:
- Union Minister **Ashwini Vaishnaw** announced India's ambition to become a top-5 semiconductor nation.
- India is developing a *full ecosystem* for semiconductor production, with students designing chipsets now in *fabrication*.
- The country’s **electronics exports** have surged significantly, supporting major advancements in the semiconductor industry.

items.title: Shortsighted rules, shrinking growth: How legal metrology thwarts India’s manufacturing dream
items.author: Lakshita Mehrotra, Sudhanshu Neema
items.summary:
* India's legal metrology regulations cause unnecessary burdens for manufacturers with overly complex labeling and measurement requirements. 
* These regulations lead to confusion and legal battles, stifling growth, particularly for MSMEs. 
* Simplifying these laws could foster a more robust manufacturing sector and enhance consumer protection through risk-based, digital-first approaches.

items.title: Nvidia's China Restart Faces Production Obstacles
items.summary:
- *Nvidia* has limited supplies of its most powerful **AI chip**, the H20, due to U.S. export restrictions, although it plans to resume sales to China. 
- The U.S. government's April ban affected production, causing *Nvidia* to void customer orders and manufacturing capacity with **TSMC**. 
- CEO **Jensen Huang** stated new chip production may take nine months, while *Nvidia* develops a compliant chip, the **RTX Pro GPU**.

items.title: Indian electronics exports hit $40 bn
items.summary:
- India's electronics exports surpassed *$40 billion*, marking an **eight-fold** growth over 11 years.
- Domestic production of electronics has increased by *six times*, highlighting rapid sector development.
- Minister *Ashwini Vaishnaw* emphasized India's ambition to be among the top five semiconductor nations soon, with upcoming projects like the *Made in India* semiconductor chip.

items.title: Torrent Pharma Seeks CCI Nod for Major JB Chemicals Acquisition
items.summary:
- Torrent Pharmaceuticals is seeking *CCI clearance* to acquire a majority stake in *JB Chemicals* for ₹19,500 crore.
- This acquisition will catapult Torrent to become India's second-largest *pharmaceutical company*.
- The deal involves acquiring 46.39% from promoters and making an open offer for an additional 26% stake.

items.title: US proposes steep tariffs on critical EV battery material
items.summary:
* The US Commerce Department has imposed **93.5% tariffs** on imported graphite essential for EV batteries, citing 'dumping' practices by Chinese suppliers. 
* This decision adds pressure on automakers like **Tesla** and **Ford**, escalating production costs for electric vehicles as tax credits are set to expire. 
* The ruling affects US manufacturers investing in battery production, with potential price increases of **$1,000 or more** for consumers due to rising raw material costs.

items.title: MP First Choice of Investors: CM Mohan Yadav at Diaspora Address
items.summary:
- *Madhya Pradesh CM Mohan Yadav* emphasized the state's position as the *first choice for investors*, fostering national progress.
- During the *Madhya Pradesh Global Dialogue 2025*, Yadav conducted discussions with European textile machinery leaders on establishing production hubs in Madhya Pradesh.
- He highlighted *investor-friendly policies* and the commitment to *sustainable production*, inviting European companies to invest in the region.

items.title: Amidst complaints, Dukes ball used in England-India Tests to be examined by manufacturers
Madhya Pradesh CM Meets Textile Manufacturers in Barcelona
items.summary:
- *Chief Minister Mohan Yadav* held a round-table in Barcelona with global textile machinery firms to promote Madhya Pradesh as a **manufacturing hub**.
- The meeting emphasized *technology transfer*, partnerships with European companies, and establishing dedicated textile parks in the state.
- Yadav highlighted Madhya Pradesh's favorable investment climate, supporting *sustainable production* initiatives under the *Make in India* campaign.

items.title: World’s first ethanol-to-jet fuel plant set to launch by September
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- *LanzaJet Inc* is launching the world’s first ethanol-to-jet fuel plant in Georgia by the end of September 2025, after delays due to equipment issues.
- The plant, costing $200 million, aims to produce 10 million gallons of **sustainable aviation fuel (SAF)** and renewable diesel annually.
- Initial production will rely on *Brazilian sugar-cane ethanol*, as domestic *corn-based ethanol* typically does not meet the emissions reduction standards required for certain tax credits.

items.title: India commissions indigenously built diving support vessel
items.summary:
*India has commissioned INS Nistar,* its first indigenously designed diving support vessel, capable of **deep-sea saturation diving** and **submarine rescue operations**. 
 *The vessel, built by Hindustan Shipyard Ltd, features over 80% indigenous content* and serves as a critical operational asset for both the Indian Navy and regional partners. 
 *INS Nistar's advanced technology enables it to conduct operations up to 1,000 metres deep,* enhancing India's capabilities in submarine rescue missions.

items.title: Wheels India Expands Exports and Segments
items.summary:
- *Wheels India Ltd* is expanding its export business, with notable progress in the **construction** and **tractor** segments.
- The company reported a *56% rise* in net profit for FY2025, reflecting robust growth despite tariff uncertainties.
- It is now a significant supplier to **electric vehicle** manufacturers, enhancing its market presence in various sectors.

items.title: PepsiCo Reports Growth in Snacks Business in India
items.summary:
- PepsiCo achieved *4% organic revenue growth* in its snacks sector during Q2 2025, prominently aided by markets like India.
- The company faced *declines in its beverages segment*, particularly in India, due to unseasonal weather affecting sales.
- Overall, PepsiCo's *net revenue rose by 1%* to USD 22.72 billion, with positive forecasts for ongoing resilience in its international business.

items.title: Everta aims to locally produce 3k DC chargers annually by 2027
items.summary:
- *Everta* plans to manufacture 3,000 DC chargers each year by 2027, investing ₹150 crore in its *Karnataka* facility.
- The company aims for a 15% market share in the DC charger segment by 2030, responding to a projected demand for 4 million public chargers.
- Through its partnership with *StarCharge*, Everta targets over 50% domestic value addition, promoting *local production* and reducing import reliance.

items.title: First made in India semiconductor chip to be rolled out this year
items.author: PTI
items.summary:
- India’s first *indigenous semiconductor chip* will be launched in 2025, according to Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw.
- The country aims to become a leading player in the *semiconductor manufacturing* sector, with six plants already approved.
- As part of the *India AI Mission*, training programs for AI usage are underway, with a goal of preparing one million individuals.

items.title: Perplexity's Talks to Pre-install Comet AI Browser
items.summary:
- *Perplexity AI*, supported by **Nvidia**, is in discussions with smartphone manufacturers to pre-install its new **Comet AI browser**.
- This strategy aims to capitalize on browser *stickiness*, enhancing user engagement with Perplexity’s tools by setting Comet as the **default** browser.
- The initiative could expand Perplexity's reach notably, targeting *hundreds of millions* of users in the forthcoming year after refining the desktop version.

items.title: BatX Energies and Rocklink's Rare Earth Magnet Recycling MoU
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- BatX Energies has partnered with Rocklink GmbH to create India's first integrated ecosystem for *rare earth magnet recycling*.
- The initiative combines BatX’s operational presence with Rocklink’s technical expertise and aligns with the *EU–India Trade and Technology Council*.
- The project will launch *India's first rare earth magnet refining facility* and aims to enhance the country's self-reliance in rare earth materials.

items.title: India, UK Likely to Unveil Free Trade Agreement Next Week
items.summary:
- India and the UK plan to finalize a *free trade agreement* next week, enhancing *duty-free access* for Indian textiles and electric vehicles.
- The deal will significantly reduce tariffs on British exports such as *whisky* and *cars*, fostering *bilateral trade*.
- Expected to be signed during Indian PM Modi's visit to London, the pact could benefit 99% of Indian exports to the UK.

items.title: Manali Petrochemicals expands Propylene Glycol capacity
items.summary:
- **Manali Petrochemicals Ltd** has enhanced its *Propylene Glycol* production capacity by 50,000 KTPA, aiming to reduce reliance on imports.
- This expansion supports the *'Make in India'* initiative and is expected to foster India’s global manufacturing competitiveness.
- Chairman Ashwin Muthiah emphasized the company's commitment to *sustainable growth* and market leadership in the domestic sector.
